description.narrative: UNDP COVID-19 Rapid Response Facility Resources. Ensure social stability in the country. Conduct analysis of direct socio-economic impact of the crisis and its spillover effects on the most vulnerable groups of Kazakhstan population.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: A rapid assessment of the COIVID-crisis impact on the most vulnerable to help the Government recalibrate support measures accordingly

comment.narrative: No analysis has been done to date on direct socio-economic impact of the COVID-crisis and its spillover effects on the most vulnerable groups of Kazakhstan population

1) Development of questionnaires for various categories of the population. Identification of target groups. 2) Conducting a nationwide survey of 12,000 respondents through the Talap mobile app, upgraded for visually impaired people. 3) Data analysis, development of anti-crisis package of offers and services, presentation of the results to the key stakeholders. 4) Development of a recovery strategy and action plan informed by the results of the following two components.

1) For technical implementation, UNDP has partnered with a national think tank “TALAP” that has a deep understanding of the development context and the current situation. “TALAP” spearheaded the development of the questionnaires, with the key stakeholders from the UN agencies and the government providing their input on the questionnaire content. The key target groups covered were: SMEs and self-employed, population, including vulnerable social groups, namely the economically active population, elderly and/or single people, persons with disabilities, disadvantaged and other vulnerable categories, parents with children under 6 years of age, as well as the key stakeholders in education and healthcare. 2) The overall sample amounted to 12,067 participants across all 14 regions and 3 key cities of the country. The survey was conducted from 5 May to 10 June 2020. 3) According to the SEIA, a deterioration of the financial situation caused by quarantine measures is noted by 51% of the unemployed, 45% of low-income people, 42% of persons with disabilities, 36% of the economically active population. Quarantine measures and the state of emergency heavily impacted the most vulnerable groups of the population, as demonstrated by the indirect indicators: 40% of the unemployed and 38% of low income people reported that they could not afford enough food; 43% of the unemployed and low income people reported difficulties paying for utilities; 38% of the unemployed and 47% of low income people had to borrow money and/or take loans to pay for staple commodities. Covid-19 is devastating small businesses, currently employing 3.3 mln. people. 69.6% of SMEs were forced to suspend their economic activities and another 2.2% completely stopped operating during the quarantine. Self-employed people suffered even more, with 71% suspending their activities due to the introduction of quarantine measures. Women-entrepreneurs were more affected by quarantine measures and the state of emergency than men: during the period of quarantine, 69% of women-owned SMEs stopped their activities, compared with 59% of men-entrepreneurs. The results of the SEIA were presented to the Ministry of Labour and Social Protection, and other stakeholders including IFIs. 4) The United Nations Country Team (UNCT) developed Kazakhstan´s COVID-19 Socio-Economic Response & Recovery Plan, guided by the global UN Framework for the Immediate Socio-economic Response to COVID-19´s five pillars, the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (2021-2025), the Common Country Analysis, the Socio-Economic Impact Assessment (SEIA), as well as the wider regional Framework on Socio-Economic Response to COVID-19.
